newsitem.title: UK: Budgens saw strong sales in January.
newsitem.headline: Budgens saw strong sales in January.

text.p: Budgens Plc, the second line supermarket group, reported strong sales growth in January on Monday but added that as usual the group failed to benfit from the kind of bumper growth enjoyed by the supermarket giants over the Christmas period. Pretax profits for the 28 weeks to November 10 rose 17.7 percent to 5.04 million stg, with the interim payout up 14.3 percent to 0.40 pence per share. Sales were 183 million, compared to a restated 169.3 million for 1995, which excludes National Lottery ticket sales.
John von Spreckelsen, chief executive, said "Budgens continues to perform well despite extremely competitive market conditions."

"The Christmas trading period has traditionally not had the same impact on the Budgens store portfolio as it has on the superstores. The group experienced a lower rate of growth in the run-up to Christmas and comparatively strong sales thereafter into January."
Like-for-like sales were up 4.5 percent in the period, with total sales up 8.1 percent. The period saw operating margins improve to 3.6 percent from 3.4 percent.
